title: How to give someone hope - Quora

response.answer_text: This is difficult for me to answer, because there’s are a few specific people in my life who I try to give hope to, but I often fail. However, there are a few tips I feel qualitfied to give you. The one time I remember properly making someone feel better was when I was around 8 or 9. I remember being in my bedroom with my current best friend at the time, who was sleeping over for 2 weeks. We were talking, as we did for hours every night, and somehow or another she got to crying about her father. He had passed away a few years ago…and she had loved him very much. And I remember trying to console her- but trying to reconcile her feelings about her father didn’t work. So I said something funny, I don’t remember what. I played pretend, I made a few jokes, I hugged her. And she was crying, but she smiled. I know it was a true smile. That’s why it stuck in my memory. It was the one time I had really given someone hope in a desperate moment. When you can’t make someone feel better about whatever is despairing them- make them smile. Just make them smile somehow, it doesn’t matter how, but however well you know them, find that tender spot that can’t resist your humor and press on it. Making a crying girl smile was like unlocking the sun itself. My dad has often given me hope at my worst moments by assuring me of the truth- I’m extrememly guilt-prone, you see, and I don’t think very highly of myself, but according to my dad, I’m a good person. Only, it doesn’t work if you’re lying; this trick only works if someone is delusioned about something: make an anorexic realize he’s not fat, assure a friend who’s worried about being friendless that you won’t leave them. Make them believe it, but always tell the truth. If you know what someone needs, and you can deliver, then deliever! I think that’s the most important part. Give a homeless guy a dollar and tell him about a store you know is hiring people. Make a friend a get-well card when she’s feeling depressed. Do what you need to do when it’s right to do it- compliment someone. Smile at someone. Say hello to the lonely kid at lunch. Just do anything that brings light to the world- real, tangible light, because in a world of darkness, a sliver of light can be a huge saving grace to a lot of people. Wow, I oughta start using my own ideas…thank you for asking this question and reminding me of who I’m meant to be. Peace out!

Thanks for A2A. I would start with a quote- Trust your Hopes, not Fears said by David Mahoney. In the movie Dumb and Dumber, Jim Carrey finally gets a date with his ideal woman and tells her he is in love with her. Then he asks her,” What do you think are my chances -one out of ten?” After barely a moment’s thought, she bluntly answers,” More like one in a million.” Carrey grows very serious, and guess what would be his reaction- the same old feeling of being sad and devastated? NO. Instead, a huge smile breaks out on his face.”Wow!” he exclaims ecstatically.“I have a chance!” For once at least, this character’s simplemindedness works in his favor. He is the eternal optimist, acknowledging the one-millionth of the glass that is full, rather than the rest that is empty. His attitude is more prone to create success than someone who would be turned away by initial rejection. Many great people were rejected before they became celebrities. Can anyone imagine Einstein failed at Mathematics, or Beethoven’s music teacher called him hopeless as a composer, or Beatles were rejected by several record companies before they made their first album. A Big NO, right? but all of this actually happened. Even the creator of our famous cartoon character Mickey Mouse, Walt Disney was fired by a newspaper editor for lack of ideas. And eventually how successful he became is a history!! If all these people can do it even after huge setbacks and why can’t we, we are no different than them except the Mindset, because it is our mindset that determines everything we are and are capable of becoming. Our destiny is determined not by chance, but by choice. No matter what chances you are quoted by statistics, you have the ability to make your own statistic. Sometimes all you need is that one chance in a million. If you capitalize on it, it is all worth it. Say to yourself- I make every experience work for me, everything that happens to me is an opportunity to further my success.  Thank you for reading Keep Smiling|Keep Shining.

You give someone hope by being their hope. You try this experiment. Tell her everyday what she means to you even if she gets bored and or annoyed. She will resent and doubt and have difficulty accepting all those compliments, but that is where you stand. You are there to be her crying shoulder, to be her hope, the pillar the can hold on to when she feels like her world is crumbling. It may sound easy but it's not. It is a two man job. She has to work on it as well. Then I hear you ask, “How am I supposed to do that? She won't even listen to me.” Then make her listen. Stand your ground and make it clear to her that you are not going to let her drown in her anxiety. You have to believe that you can as well. It is never an easy job, and sometimes you need convincing yourself. The key here is patience. It is a long and gruelling process to go through once she's had her mindset, but if you are determined to change that for her, you'll have to stick with all her issues and problems. Be there. You also need to tell her what's wrong with how she's acting. A problem would never be solved if the person doesn't see the problem at all. You'll have to assess it and think of ways. Experiment. Tell her you're proud, tell her that she is better and meant for better things. You have to believe in her. Be her influence. Be her hope. Once she sees that you are unfailing and sees that you are her hope. She will slowly adjust, slowly change her mindset. The words you tell her will stay with her subconscious. It will repeat over and over uuntil that's what's programmed into her mind. You be her hope.

Hope, like happiness, can't be given so much as it's you helping the person come to the realization or the option of hope. Hope is a personal choice that people often make when presented with certain acceptable evidences. Infomercials tend to peddle hope by showing you a perceived problem and the perfect solution. You watch and you're sure you can do it too. You can solve that problem, you are sure you can do it because you saw someone else do it and succeed magnificently. Hope comes in many forms. Some of us put our hope in material things, money, house etc. Others put our hope in more personal matters like love, relationships, peace of mind etc. We all hope that this one thing will bring us clarity, happiness. To help someone clarify and realize hope, you must first understand true hope. Not hope in something that has a shelf life or an expiration date. Those things are at eye level however grand or emotionally stirring they may be. They expire or don’t stand up to the rigors of time. True hope comes from something much higher than that. As a spiritually connected person my hope comes from my belief in Jesus Christ. This might be offensive to some and ridiculous to others. But I speak not from inexperience but from the safety of a personal relationship with Christ. This relationship underlies every other issue, problem or despairing situation I have faced. It answers my questions and is as true now as it was in the beginning almost 40 years now. Now, to be clear, I am not peddling Christianity, it is your choice whether to accept or not. Unlike infomercials, I get nothing from this beyond the satisfaction that you too can find peace and clarity through hope. I have my hope set and affirmed. It brings me a peace that is beyond understanding, so I share it with you because why would I not want to share good news if I have it? So whoever you need to share hope with make sure you have personal experience with true hope. This way you are authentic and can speak with authority. Also there is no “use by date" on your hope. It's hope that is eternal. For further notes on my hope in Christ feel free to ask if you have questions. Thanks.

The first thing to do is, 'Empathise'. There is nothing as comforting as hearing that ‘someone understands’. The next thing to do is ‘listen without interrupting them’. If you are into medicines, it's like draining an abscess. When you let all the pus out, you can hope for quick recovery. Since they have had no one to talk to or let out or share their frustration with, they tend to become sore and prefer to live alone. Always remember, 'People like being alone, THEY DONT FANCY BEING ALONE'. So they may tell you to leave them alone, but it should be your call to hold your ground and tell them that you want to stand by them. The idea should be to show them how 'companionship is better that sulking ALONE'. How you could go for a movie, have supper together at a great diner gossiping about a common friend or having sex. The next thing you could do is to appreciate them, and make them realise that their presence in the world is actually felt/realised. Tell them how they are important to you or how you would like them to accompany you to your job interview or a local game . Also appreciate them on their talents, they may draw/sketch well. They may be a great listener, or a great talker and you could make them aware of their qualities. See, they are not dead, they just need a spark of light to rekindle them. If you can be physically cosy with them, then always go for a back hug or rest your head on their lap or vice versa. Where resting your head on their lap kindles a thought of affection, that you consider them as a loved so as to lie on their lap and ‘them, resting their head on your lap' makes them feel that you are there for them.

This is quite an acute description, which bears a little questioning… A helpful 1st question to consider to get this into proportion are they eating? Are they watching tv/engaging with computer etc? Their attention may be fully engaged with things that are not discernible in the physical reality that you share. If so, you relaxing on worrying and allowing yours and their some space and time for motivations to stir may work wonders… Especially if you get rid of your television..and wifi networks… A daily meditative practice of about 15–20 minutes (eg, Isha Kriya) is likely to be a helpful starting point. You may prefer something more energised, such as Sadhguru’s health meditation; both are available on youtube. Your daily practice will enable you to relax, and allow new inspirations. If there is anything specific and relevant for you to do in relation to this person, you can be inspired into it, rather than worrying into it. Worry and concern perpetuate their causes. They are presentations of our own state of mind, not an objective assessment of someone else’s state of being, which may be as much of a mystery to them as ours is to us. One starting point can be to really ease up on these adjectives and ways of seeing them that you mention here. If you like, you can practise seeing them in ways that are beyond these social definitions, which they seem to be refusing to conform to. This indicates a strong state of desire and focus on their part. With a little freedom of mind being introduced to your experience, you may find that life begins to stir into new, and inspiring, forms of representation.

Just read something by Blaise Pascal that might apply to what your friend is going through. It is an observation about human nature that can only be explained (and potentially remedied) through the application of Christian theology. We know from experience that humans can fall into pride on one side or despair on the other. Your friend appears to be experiencing the second problem. Here is Pascal’s analysis which I think if seriously considered can help to right the boat. "It is, however, an astonishing thing that the mystery furthest removed from our knowledge, namely, that of the transmission of original sin, should be a fact without which we can have no knowledge of ourselves. For it is beyond doubt that there is nothing which more shocks our reason than to say that the sin of the first man has rendered guilty those, who, being so removed from this source, seem incapable of participation in it. This transmission does not only seem to us impossible, it seems also very unjust. For what is more contrary to the rules of our miserable justice than to damn eternally an infant incapable of will, for a sin wherein he seems to have so little a share, that it was committed six thousand years before he was in existence? Certainly nothing offends us more rudely than this doctrine; and yet, without this mystery, the most incomprehensible of all, we are incomprehensible to ourselves. The knot of our condition takes its twists and turns in this abyss, so that man is more inconceivable without this mystery than this mystery is inconceivable to man. It is not by the proud exertions of our reason, but by the simple submission of reason, that we can truly know ourselves. These foundations, solidly established on the inviolable authority of religion, make us know that there are two truths of faith equally certain: the one, that man, in the state of creation, or in that of grace, is raised above all nature, made like unto God and sharing in His divinity; the other, that in the state of corruption and sin, he is fallen from this state and made like unto the beasts. Without this divine knowledge what could men do but either become elated by the inner feeling of their past greatness which still remains to them, or become despondent at the sight of their present weakness? Some considering nature as incorrupt, others as incurable, they could not escape either pride or sloth, the two sources of all vice; since they cannot but either abandon themselves to it through cowardice, or escape it by pride. For if they knew the excellence of man, they were ignorant of his corruption; so that they easily avoided sloth, but fell into pride. And if they recognised the infirmity of nature, they were ignorant of its dignity; so that they could easily avoid vanity, but it was to fall into despair. The Christian religion alone has been able to cure these two vices, not by expelling the one through means of the other according to the wisdom of the world, but by expelling both according to the simplicity of the Gospel." - Pensées (139)

You can’t. Hope is a choice, specifically the choice to believe that “tomorrow” (or five minutes from now) could be better. You can’t “give” hope any more than you can “give” faith or trust, or anything similar. However, sometimes, when hope doesn’t seem possible, endurance may still be possible. Getting through the next chunk of time, putting one foot in front of the other, may achieve a goal in spite of the absence of hope. In that case, help that person stay focused on their goal. (Hope may sneak in along the way.) Even if there is no goal, what you can do is assist that person to find someone who will stand beside them in their troubles, even if that person is not in a position to do anything other than that. You can also encourage them to do something positive for themselves, like take a 10-minute walk, or sit in the sun for a short time. Or encourage them to do something positive for someone else. Or, depending on their faith, pray with them and/or ask others to pray with them, for them. Depression is an odd thing. And it sometimes has biological sources. Please support the person to get checked out by their physician to make sure there isn’t something wonky with their body/brain chemistry.

No doubt that motivation is very very important but motivation cannot be applied to all the areas of problems within the mind. When do we lose hope, have you ever observed? When we have an unclear mind and it seems impossible to get rid of something like thoughts or situation or circumstances. There are circumstances where we do not have any control, then how motivation will help if a person has lost all his hope in relation to changing something beyond his control? So first we need a very clear and peaceful mind to regain inside energy. Before understanding how to clear complications within the mind, let's first understand that what's unclear mind, see unclear mind means a mind which is full of complicated situations and circumstances which causes the feelings and emotions which we try to avoid and it usually happens where we don't spend time with ourself, when we don't question our beliefs and when we don't analyse the situation very calmly. Whenever we start feeling negative we start doing foolish things like eating what we love, talking to people we believe we love, taking rest from work and etc. Whenever we start feeling negative and that could be relating to anything like to a person whom you like but that person is not available and you're just stuck in the thoughts, etc. Only you can understand yourself. Negativity is very important because whenever you feel negative that may be regarded as a sign that something is going wrong. A guy, having bank balance of 10 crores, jumped from 10th floor due to depression. This unclear mind has nothing to do with what you have, it happens when we stop spending time with ourselves. So from the above you must have understood that what's unclear mind, what are the causes and how to deal with it. Once you start spending time with yourself you'll be able to unleash many of your wrong believes. Once your mind is at peace now you need motivation to move further and not just motivation you also need self confidence so for this you need to write few moments in which you did something which was really inspiring. If you don't know where you want to go and you're motivating yourself that I'll reach my destination, you'll always lose hope . Once the route is clear with instructions life becomes simple.

It depends on why they lost hope. If you don't know the "why," it's hard to determine the "how," as in how to fix the issue. It's great that you're asking so you can find a solution. I wish more people would try to understand like you are. It frustrates me that people don't realize how deeply complex it is to solve such a deep and complex issue. Speaking from personal experience, the person who lost hope is the only person who has the key to restoring their hope. It can be a grueling process. It may or may not be linear. The more chaotic the reasons for losing hope, more often than not the solution will be chaotic. If the person you are trying to help has complicated problems, be a light to them in the dark. You can't save them all on your own, but you can be supportive. Empathize and be there for them as a form of stability. Don't sacrifice your own self care (you're not being selfish, but it can appear so to someone who doesn't have a clear perspective), but explain that you can best be there for them as a friend when you are taking care of yourself (if this conversation ever needs to happen; it may not).

How can I give someone hope? If you are a Christian you can lead her to Jesus Christ and the forgiveness of sin promised in his Name. John 1:1–14, John 3:1–18, 1 John 1, 1John 5:10–13. We have all sinned, but Jesus cleanses us both from the sin and the shame of the sin. He makes us a new person from the inside when we give ourselves to Him (we are “born again", becoming children of God). That said, it is not easy to entrust ourselves to someone else, to give all of our lives to Him. Yet, that is what He requires if He is to heal us. That is why faith is required, because only if you trust Him fully, will you be willing to repent and give yourself to Him fully. But… it is worth it! It gives hope, removes our guilt and shame, and allows us to live with the knowledge that we are precious and loved by God, enabling us to forget about ourselves and see the needs of others instead.

I don’t gain motivation from hopes. but from the fact that I have been allowed the opportunity to experience life, through all the ups and downs, for better or worse. The value of human being, the meaning of life, lies in the word “BEING”, to be in the process of LEARNING & CREATING called LIFE EXPERIENCING. What is ‘hope’? Could too-many-hopes be a burden? Could some hopes be trivial and useless in the first place? Could a long list of hopes be trimmed down to a short list of needs representing just the basics of a healthy living ? Could the needs for the basic turn into executable, controllable plan of actions ? Leading a simple life does not require much superfluous effort, here I assume that one still has his/her physical and mental health, and with the up-keeping well managed. A simple healthy living means less or no anxiety, and no more lost hopes… hopes for illusive gains, fame, fortune, relationship, pleasures, etc. which are originated from the illusive greed-driven ego self. A healthy life starts with a healthy mind, one cannot have a balanced, harmonious interaction with the outside world unless one has the correct mindset, composing of the right set of values and understandings, and the proper methodology to think, perceive and conceptualize. Memories, hopes, desires, emotions and the like are the outputs of the mind. With the wrong set of values coupled with a faulty processing, good inputs could turn into bad outputs… not just garbage in and garbage out, also good in and garbage out! Mind cleansing and revitalizing are most important life-long task for all humans, not just for those who have lost all hopes, but for those who are lucky enough to live in their hope-full-filling lives. A correct, peaceful mind will help one go through the ups and downs of life with ease, seeing them as just the experiences of living, being in the learning and creating process. To achieve the right mindset, one might adopt the following approach:- read up , via the internet or your local libraries, on meditation, and / or go for some reputable meditation training.explore the real meaning of meditation, dig through more cross references.verify if it works by self experimenting, experiencing.If it works on you, adopt and practice, (NOT believe and practice).trust your intuition to lead you through the path of awakening and enlightenment.knowing that in the mental realm, you, despite any physical limitation on the outside, are absolutely FREE to learn and relearn , to create and recreate; for there, in the mental realm, lies the source of unlimited, invigorating power, ready to be tapped. It is wise to make the best use of it. You may hardly change the physical constraints on the outside, but you have the liberty to perceive them differently given the right mindset.knowing that fate can play havoc on your life despite your best effort. True ? Yes and No. Given that you have the the right mindset to lead a life of healthiness (not putting you or others in harms way), the power of Nature (the Creator) is on your side, and you, with the divine blessing, can rewrite your fate and destiny, at the least, to shorten and alleviate the downs of life.Instead of hoping that you might overcome your current situation, please repeat the following affirmation to yourself, a few times daily : I shall overcome! Say it out loud, and feel it coming through, out from the deepest, purest part of your inner self. Meantime, get ready and go for the life-long learning and practicing of meditation and enlightenment.

Champion the good you see in them.Applaud the things of value you see them do.Praise them in front of them.Encourage them to apply their gifts and talents by serving others in the community.Let them know they're worth loving.Ask for their help or advice if you're working on something they have a passion for.Let them know you're thinking about them.Show up for the events that matter to them.In summary, we all need to know that we are valuable, that we're seen, that we have good things to offer the world. People who affirm that are true treasures, and it makes me suspect you are one of those treasures. :) Thank you for wanting to be a hope-giver.

Work with the to start to win. Start with examples of real people who pulled their lies out of seemingly hopeless situations by using abilities they already have. My life is one example. I had no job, no employability, no friends, no money, no family to help, and the rent was due. I had been eating Folgers company foods available to the appointment makes. That left the meager income for my wife’s food. Then, I accepted a job offer from a company that fizzled, and even the free lunch, and meager appointment-maker income were gone. Disaster was at hand. The SGI-Nichiren method bumped into me, and everything started to change when I decided to check it out. The method is based on dumping limiting concept, and using the mind-mouth to infuse rationality into life. Why rationality? That is necessary because I had made poor decisions that brought me to disaster. The job-money thing cleared up, and I became relationship capable.

Talk to them about what hope means to them. Ask them to recall a memory of when they had it. Remind them that if there was no hope for the future suicide would be the only natural solution. But it’s because there is hope for survival we have to hold onto the chance for another day. Metaphors about growing plants even in the bleakest of weather conditions, the story of Hugh Glass, or even the new borns still alive after days without care. Marva Collins returning hope to her neighborhood by giving the kids an actual education in a loving school/environment. Theirs was a way of life doomed to failure because of where they were being raised. Stories are so powerful. Use them because they are one of the best tools we have to help others make changes.

I ask you not to get encouraged , I ask you to widen your awareness. Most people generally lose hope and fearful of future because in past they have not used their time well , rather most of it was wasted on useless activities . Instead of acquiring new knowledge and skill and good habits it was used to watch TV , movies and gossip. Gradually they had been turning blind eye to their problems till they become utter chaos . Now no escape is possible , this is how most of them think. Anxiety and fear grips . But past is gone , you can't do anything about it . Future has yet not come . But you can always decide what you do in present moment . Power to act always lie in the present moment. Let your past be a school only. Don't worry , don't regret but see what lessons you can learn from your past . No one can help you unless you are ready to decide , plan and act on your goals . Discipline your day .Start with the smaller goals like even waking up 20 minutes early or reading for 30 minutes daily . Action in right direction , howsoever small may be loosen the grip of negative emotions. Begin now. Regards

-shrugs-. That hope isn’t what they’ve been told it is. It’s not a wishy-washy thing. It’s not a magic wand. That while they may not be able to feel it, the Last Hope is still with them, will in fact never leave them. When you are depressed - really depressed - every breath you take is a whisper of hope and defiance. It’s you - your autonomic system, if nothing else - fighting to keep you alive for one second longer. It’s not always agood idea TELLING people that, of course. Helps sometimes. That I have been in the abyss they are in - maybe for different reasons, but I’ve been there. And hope was with me. Even when I couldn’t feel her, she was there. I understand that they can’t feel it now. But that doesn’t mean they are alone. It’s a bit late, and this is rambly, so I’m not going to continue, except for the last time I had to talk with someone who had no hope :- I explained to her, calmly and rationally, why Junko Enoshima was actually a Hope Character. This annoyed her, but gradually made her start believing in hope.

For me I just try to give them positive encouragement, words about how good they are by pointing out their qualities…but it depends on what their problem is. If they are down because of an ill family member I just try to point out miraculous stories of other people's survival….basically remain positive,genuine, a good listener…I noticed that some people are just naturally down in the dumps for most of their lives…but just as you think your finally making progress with them ,because you see them happy….they come crashing down again…your not doing it wrong it's just the way they are. But can drain your own energy source. Take a break then just be there for them another time. But depends on person and reason for their loss of hope….

Imo: Be there. Let them know you care. Let them know they matter. Help them to get a doctors appointment for a check up. Help them talk to a counsellor/support line. Don’t ever invalidate their feelings with good intentions. Don’t give them mantras. If mantras worked for them they’d already be using them. Just let them know they are not alone, and that you will listen. So listen. Don’t fill silences with needs other than theirs. Let them tell you what they need when they are ready. This is important: Find the information mentioned, just in case. If you believe they are in real danger of self harm, please contact the police/doctor/help line for support, and direction.

I believe it sounds like you are battling some form of depression. Depression is very real, and needs to be treated as any other illness. Beginning in my late teens until now (I am 53) I have struggled with this (depression). It was not until I was in my 40’s that I finally got some professional help, and it has changed my life for the better. I still have to do the work, and there isn’t really a magic pill (although medication has helped me). I still have speed bumps I endure, but I have the tools to deal with them. I feel so much better about myself, and have a higher level of self esteem. I only wish I had sought help when I was younger. It is impossible to tell you the importance of getting professional help. This can be through a counselor, therapist, psychiatrist, pastor, etc….There may be free services where you are, you just need to do a google search. If you think you don’t “fit” in this world, are “abnormal” or “weird” I can assure you that you are NOT. There is a spot for everyone at this table called life. Hoping you much luck in your journey.

Plan a big dinner that requires her help. When someone gets dug into something in their minds like that, it can be pointless to reason with them about it. Just distract them until life changes. Distractions that cause the change.  Imagine being required to make all of these in record time. A new mind bust could be seen as a change of internal scenery.

You can’t, really. Trying will just bring you down to their level. It’s up to each person to create their own happiness, and that includes you. The best way to encourage it is to champion it in your own life. You cannot make people do things but you can influence them by representing the behavior yourself. If negative people can “rub off on you” then so can positive people. Please do not try forcing anything on other people though. The idea that you can force people to change is not healthy. You will be disappointed in the end and the person you are forcing to change will eventually resent you for it. Focus instead on what you can control which is how you interact with others and how you respond to them.

I don’t ever decide if someone has hope in life. That decision is made solely by that individual. Generally people who have reached that conclusion don’t ask for advice, nor follow it if given. They need professional help to get them out of suicidal tendencies and behavior and then to turn them on to a path of balanced positive thought. Because of the serious damage they can cause to themselves or others, lay persons should not try to heap their inexperience disguised as advice IMHO. The best help in such cases is to get them professional help if you are able to. If not, alert someone in their family or close friends who care and who can.

Google the author Victor Frankel and go from there. The book is about a Jewish psychiatrist that survived the Holocaust. An incredibly interesting story without a lot of gory details and relatively short read or listen. After the war, he and a friend established a process called logotherapy that is designed to help people find meaning in life. Basically, he says the only thing that makes life worth living is that you mean something to someone else.
